Literature Review: The intersection of hematology and genetics has led to a deeper understanding of the complex relationships between blood cells and genes. This review aims to explore the historical development of this field, highlighting key findings and discoveries that have shaped our understanding of human genetics and hemoglobinopathies. We will examine the role of the glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) system, the clonal nature of paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH), and the impact of somatic mutations on disease progression. We will also discuss the concept of Darwinian selection and its relevance to understanding the evolution of genetic disorders. By tracing the journey from blood cells to genes and back, we will gain insight into the intricate mechanisms that govern human health and disease.
